importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the game and the announcement of Game 7 in the ALCS, marking a pivotal moment in the postseason.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The game occurred on October 20, 2025, and is the final game of the ALCS, setting up the World Series matchup.

keyTakeAways: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hits his sixth home run in the postseason, extending the Blue Jays' lead to 5-0 and contributing to the Blue Jays' 6-2 victory over the Mariners.
The Blue Jays force a Game 7 in the ALCS after Seattle's season-high three errors, including two in the second inning, leading to early runs.
The Mariners’ pitcher Yesevage throws a season-high 31 splitters, recording seven strikeouts and giving up only six hits and three walks, showcasing composure.
The Blue Jays have not won a pennant since 1985 and are now in a Game 7 scenario for the first time in their history, which is significant due to the rarity of such a situation.
The winner of the ALCS will face the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series, with Game 1 scheduled for Friday.
The game marks the second time in Blue Jays history that they play a Game 7, and the first since 1985.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hits his sixth home run of the postseason as the Toronto Blue Jays defeat the Seattle Mariners 6-2, forcing a decisive Game 7 in the American League Championship Series. The game is marked by Seattle’s season-high three errors, including two in the second inning, which led to early runs by Toronto. Key contributions include Barger’s RBI singles and a two-run homer, and Yesavage’s strong pitching performance. The Blue Jays, who have not won a pennant since 1985, now face the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series, with Game 1 scheduled for Friday.
title: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hits sixth homer of postseason as Blue Jays dominate Mariners to force ALCS Game 7
